Description: The lower part of an ivory leg: in the form of a bull's foot, consisting of the pedestal upon which the foot rested. The sides of the fragment are decorated, as usual, with incised lines. The ivory has been completely blackened by burning, but is still solid.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Prof Walter B Emery
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' II (London, 1954), 44, no. 159 and pl.XXVII.
